Package io.sbk.api

Interface Storage<T>

  • public interface Storage<T>
    Interface for Benchmarking.

        void addArgs​(Parameters params)
      throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Add the driver specific command line arguments.

        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If an exception occurred.

      • parseArgs

        void parseArgs​(Parameters params)
        throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Parse the driver specific command line arguments.
        Parameters:
        params - Parameters object to be parsed for driver specific parameters/arguments.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If an exception occurred.

      • openStorage

        void openStorage​(Parameters params)
          throws java.io.IOException
        Open the storage device / client to perform the benchmarking.
        Parameters:
        params - Parameters object enclosing all commandline arguments, see Parameters to get the basic benchmarking parameters.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If an exception occurred.

      • closeStorage

           throws java.io.IOException
        Close the Storage device / client.
        Parameters:
        params - Parameters object enclosing all commandline arguments, see Parameters to get the basic benchmarking parameters.
        Throws:

                           Parameters params)

        Parameters:
        id - Reader id
        params - Parameters object enclosing all commandline arguments, see Parameters to get the basic benchmarking parameters.
        Returns:
        Reader return the Reader , null in case of failure

      • createCallbackReader

        default CallbackReader<T> createCallbackReader​(int id,
                                               Parameters params)
        Create a Single Async Reader / Consumer. By default, No Async readers (push readers) for storage. Hence, returns null. If your storage device supports only the Async read, then implement this method.
        Parameters:
        id - Reader id
        params - Parameters object enclosing all commandline arguments, see Parameters to get the basic benchmarking parameters.
        Returns:
        Reader return the Async Reader , null in case of failure

      • getDataType

        default DataType<T> getDataType()
                         throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Default implementation to create a payload or data to write/read. Default data type is byte[]. If your Benchmark data type is other than byte[] then you need to implement your own Data class. If the data type of your Benchmark, Reader and Writer classes is byte[] (Byte Array), then use this default implementation as it is.
        Returns:
        Data Data interface.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if data type is other than byte[]
